Question_1.Context: The paper discusses the etching characteristics of Si{100} in pure and NH2OH-added NaOH. It mentions the importance of etch rate in silicon micromachining for MEMS-based sensors and actuators.
Question_1.Question: What is the etch rate defined as in silicon micromachining?
Question_1.A: Vertical distance etched per unit area
Question_1.B: Vertical distance etched per unit time
Question_1.C: Horizontal distance etched per unit time
Question_1.D: Horizontal distance etched per unit area
Question_1.Source: It is defined as the vertical distance etched per unit time (i.e., etch depth (d) per unit time (t) or d/t).

Question_2.Context: The paper discusses the effect of aging on the etching characteristics of Si{100} in NH2OH-added NaOH.
Question_2.Question: What happens to the etch rate with the aging of NH2OH-added NaOH?
Question_2.Source: It can obviously be noted that the etch rate significantly decreases up to two days, but there is a minor change after the third day.

Question_3.Context: The paper discusses the undercutting rate at convex corners in pure and NH2OH-added NaOH.
Question_3.Question: What happens to the undercutting rate at convex corners when NH2OH is added to NaOH?
Question_3.Source: It clearly indicates that the undercutting rate increases significantly when NH2OH is added to 10 M NaOH.

Question_4.Context: The paper discusses the effect of etchant age on the undercutting rate.
Question_4.Question: How does the undercutting rate change with the age of the etchant?
Question_4.Source: The undercutting rate follows the same trend as the etch rate. It decreases with etchant age and becomes stable after two days of the etchant age.

Question_7.Context: The paper discusses the applications of high undercutting rate in NH2OH-added NaOH.
Question_7.Question: Why is high undercutting rate beneficial in the fabrication of MEMS components?
Question_7.Source: High etch rate is beneficial to decrease the etching time and hence the higher throughput, which is inevitable for industrial application to reduce the product cost.

Question_9.A: Formation of pyramids or hillocks on the surface
